name: Green Prophet
tag_list: green-tech, clean-tech, solar-energy, media, blog, middle-east, israel, lebanon, saudi-arabia, syria, qatar, uae, united-arab-emirates, islam, arab-world, energy-efficiency, smart-grid, renewable-energy, oil, fossil-fuel, libya, egypt, jordan
overview: Green Prophet is the leading source of green tech and environment news for the Middle East. Read by an international audience, the site features that latest clean tech developments from Israel, all the way to the growing pains of new tech projects in Masdar City. The blog is authored by about 20 writers from around the globe, who write with the Middle East in mind. The blog is read by the United Nations Environment Programme head, the World Bank, VCs, and locally by green activists and international journalists in the Middle East. Featured on CNet, Fast Company, AOL News, the Huffington Post, TreeHugger, Al Jazeera and hundreds more, Green Prophet is also a Top 100 Green Blogs on Technorati.
